children.name: start b2
children.definition: start/ start up to make a car, engine, machine etc start working:khởi động
examples: she started the car and backed slowly out of the garage.
clean or replace the air filter before attempting to start the engine.

children.name: switch on b1
children.definition: switch on to make sth start working, for example by pressing a button - use this about things that useelectricity, for example lights, televisions, or computers:bật
examples: switch on sth/switch sth on
will you switch on the television?
i switched on the radio to listen to the news.
do you mind if i switch the light on?
exhaust fumes come into the car when i switch on the air conditioner.

children.name: get sth started b2
children.definition: get sth started/ get sth goingc2
examples: get a car/engine/machine etc started/goingto succeed in making a car etc start after having some difficulty:khởi động được cái gì
i couldn’t get my car started this morning.
he rebuilt the engine and finally got it going.
it took the repairman an hour to get the washing machine going again

children.name: turn on a2
children.definition: turn on to make sth start working, for example by turning atapor pressing abutton- use this about things that useelectricity,gas, orwater:bật
examples: turn on sth/turn sth on
he went into the bathroom and turned on the shower.
use timers to turn on indoor lights while you are away.
do you want me to turn the lights on?

children.name: put on a2
children.definition: put on to make a light, radio etc start working:bật
examples: put the light/ radio/ tv/ kettle etc on
eva put the kettle on to make a cup of coffee.
put the light on, then we can see what we’re doing.
it was so cold i put the heating back on.

children.name: set off x
children.definition: set off to do sth to make a piece of equipment that warns you about sth start: bậtbáo hiệu, cảnh báo
examples: set off sth/ set sth off
someone accidentally set off the fire alarm.
smoke alarms can be set off by smoke from cigarettes, cooking, and fireplaces
the alarm is so sensitive that the slightest movement will set it off.

children.name: activate x
children.definition: activate to make asystemstart operating - use this especially intechnicalcontexts:kích hoạt
examples: the bomb’s firing mechanism is activated by a time-clock.
the smoke activated the sprinkler system.

children.name: set sth going
children.definition: to make a clock, toy, or other machine that does not have a power supply start moving:
examples: mr carey wound up the old clock and gently set the pendulum going.
she pulled the lever that set the pump going and waited for the water.

children.name: press a button b1
children.definition: push/press a button to press a button which makes a machine start:nhấn nút
examples: what happens when you press this button?
somebody pushed the alarm button.

children.name: throw a switch b1
children.definition: throw a switch to pull a large control that switches on the electricity supply to sth:bật công tắc (lớn)
examples: the speaker of the house threw the switch for the christmas tree lights in front of the capitol building.

children.name: switch off b1
children.definition: switch off to make sth stop working, for example by pressing a button - use this about things that useelectricity, for example, lights, televisions, or computers: đóng công tắc
examples: switch off sth/ switch sth off
always switch off your computer when you’ve finished.
it’s ok - i switched the tv off before i went out.

children.name: turn off a2
children.definition: turn off to make sth stop working, for example by pressing a button or turning a tap - use this about things that useelectricity,gas, orwater:tắt
examples: turn off sth/ turn sth off
would you turn off the heater before you go to bed?
you forgot to turn the oven off!

children.name: stop b1
children.definition: stop to make anengineor amachinestop working:tắt
examples: george stopped the engine and got out of the car.
we had to stop the pump and unblock it.

children.name: press a button b1
children.definition: push/ press a button to press a button that makes a machine stop:ấn nút tắt
examples: if you want it to stop, just press the red button.

children.name: put out x
children.definition: put out to switch a light off:tắt đèn
examples: put out sth/ put sth out
norma put out the light and went to sleep.
could you put the lamp out in the bedroom, please?

children.name: turn out a2
children.definition: turn out to make alightstop working by pressing a button:tắt (đèn)
examples: don’t forget to turn out the lights when you go to bed, okay annie?

children.name: shut down b1
children.definition: shut down/ shut off if youshut offorshut downa machine, you make it stop operating:tắt
examples: the computer automatically shuts off the pump when no water is flowing.
the department of energy shut down the reactor because of safety considerations.

children.name: unplug x
children.definition: unplug to remove the thing that connects a piece ofelectricalequipment to the main electricity supply, so that it is no longer connected to it:ngắt kết nối
examples: did you remember to unplug the kettle?
i was getting a lot of crank calls, so i started unplugging my phone at night.

children.name: disconnect x
children.definition: disconnect formal to separate a piece of equipment from the mainelectricityorgassupply so that it is no longer connected to it:ngắt kết nối
examples: once a car has started, the engine would continue to run even if you disconnected the battery.

children.name: on b2
children.definition: on if sth is on, it is working - use this about lights, machines, and other things that use electricity, gas, or water:bật ,mở
examples: is the heating on? i’m freezing.
leave sth on
did you leave the kitchen light on?
keep sth on
in the winter, i keep the gas fire on all day.

children.name: be switched on b1
children.definition: be switched on use this about things that useelectricity, for example, machines, computers, or heating equipment:đã bật , mở
examples: a green light shows that the computer is switched on.
i don’t think he has his cell phone switched on.
have you checked that the power is switched on?

children.name: be turned on a2
children.definition: be turned on use this aboutmachinesor about the electricity, gas, or watersupply:mở, đã bật
examples: if the boiler fails to light, first check that the gas is turned on.
is the switch turned on?

children.name: be running b2
children.definition: be running if anengineor amachineisrunning, it is working and its parts are moving:đang chạy, vận hành
examples: do not touch the machine while it is running.
leave sth running
nick left the engine running to warm it up, while he buckled the children into their car seats

children.name: be going c2
children.definition: be going if amachineisgoing,it is working and its parts are moving:đang vận hành, chạy
examples: the clock stopped during the night, but it’s going again now.
the washing machine’s going, i can hear it.

children.name: be working a2
children.definition: be working if amachineor piece ofequipmentisworking,it has been switched on and is doing what it is supposed to do:đang hoạt động
examples: you mustn’t open the lid while the sterilizer is working.
you can hear the pump in the refrigerator when it’s working.

children.name: be ticking over x
children.definition: be ticking overukif anengineor avehicleistickingover, it is working just enough to be on, but at its lowest level:chạy cầm chừng hoặc rất chậm
examples: the plane’s engines were ticking over just enough to hold position in the air.
he left the car ticking over while he dashed into the house.

children.name: off a2
children.definition: off if sth isoff, sb has switched itoffto make it stop working - use this about lights, machines, and other things that use electricity, gas, or water:tắt
examples: is the cooker off? i can smell gas.
i don’t think anyone’s at home. all the lights are off.

children.name: be switched off b1
children.definition: be switched off  use this about things that use electricity, for example, machines, computers, or heating equipment:
examples: do you mean the alarm was switched off all night?
he didn’t realize the microphone was switched off.

children.name: be turned off a2
children.definition: be turned off use this about lights or machines, or about the electricity, gas, or water supply:được tắt
examples: make sure everything’s turned off before you leave the house.
the machine is only turned off for a few minutes at a time.

children.name: out b2
children.definition: out if a light isout,it is not shining because it has been switched off or because there is no electricity:tắt(đèn)
examples: she must have left the office as her light is out.
all the lights in the house were out.

children.name: disconnected x
children.definition: disconnected a machine, telephone, water supply etc that isdisconnectedhas had its power supply, water supply, gas supply etc completely removed so that it cannot be used:ngắt kết nối
examples: that washing machine doesn’t work. it’s been disconnected.
when the power was disconnected, he carefully removed the back of the computer.

children.name: off the hook x
children.definition: off the hook (of atelephone)not been put back correctly or has been arranged so you cannot receive any calls:ngắt kết nối
examples: i’ve been trying to call her for about half an hour. i think her phone must be off the hook.
take the phone off the hook
i locked the door and took the phone off the hook so no one could disturb me.

children.name: come on c1
children.definition: come on/ go on if a machine, light etccomesorgoes on, it starts working, especially because you have set a time for it to start - use this about things that use electricity, gas, or water:bật lên, mở lên
examples: the heating comes on automatically.
every so often, our tv just goes on by itself.

children.name: turn on a2
children.definition: switch onb1/turn on/ˌswɪtʃ, ˌtɜːʳn ˈɒn/  if a machine, light etcswitches on, it starts working - use this about things that use electricity:mở lên, bật công tắc
examples: clap your hands twice, and the light switches on.
switch/ turn itself on
water softening systems turn themselves on at night to clean the system.

children.name: turn off a2
children.definition: turn off/ switch offb1 if a machine, light etcswitchesorturns off,it stops working - use this about things that use electricity:tắt
examples: the bulb inside the refrigerator switches off when you close the door.
switch/turn itself off: tự tắt/đóng
if an automatic can opener fails to turn itself off, food is probably jamming the cutter.

children.name: go off b1
children.definition: go off if a machine, light etcgoes off, it stops working - use this about things that use electricity, water, or gas:tắt, ngừng hoạt động
examples: the heating goes off at 10:30.
after the 30-car train passed, the flashing red lights went off and the arms blocking traffic went up.

children.name: shut down b1
children.definition: shut down/ shut off if a machineshuts offorshuts down,it stops operating:tắt, ngừng vận hành
examples: the pump automatically shuts down when no water is flowing.
shut itself down/off
something caused the computer to switch itself off.

children.name: go out b1
children.definition: go out if a light goes out, it stops shining, for example because it is broken or because there is no electricity: mất điện, tắt đi
examples: suddenly all the lights went out
the street lights have a light sensor that makes them automatically go out at dawn.
